Join us in celebrating LGBTQ+ Idahoans at Pride events taking place across the state.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

After a long, hard-fought legislative session defending LGBTQ+ rights and fending off discriminatory bills, we’re excited to celebrate and be with our community of LGBTQ+ friends and allies at several Pride events taking place this summer

ACLU of Idaho staff will be attending Pride events across the state and we invite you to swing by our booth to connect with us and learn how you can join the fight in protecting LGBTQ+ communities.

The ACLU works to ensure that lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender Idahoans can live openly without discrimination and enjoy equal rights, personal autonomy and freedom of expression and association. Pride events provide an opportunity to uplift and celebrate the LGBTQ+ communities across Idaho and serve as demonstrations of our legal rights to be our truest selves. Simply put, Pride is protest.

Sign up here to volunteer to and march with the ACLU in the Boise Pride parade on June 14 and 15.

Join us at the other Pride festivals and events listed below.

  • Saturday, June 1, 10 a.m. – 2:30 p.m.: North Idaho Pride Alliance: Pride in the Park – Coeur D’Alene City Park, Coeur D’Alene.
  • Saturday, June 8, 10 a.m. – 5 p.m.: Magic Valley Pride Festival – Twin Falls City Park, Twin Falls.
  • Friday, June 14, 4 – 10 p.m.: Boise Pride Festival – Cecil D. Andrus Park, Boise.
  • Saturday, June 15, 10 a.m. – 5 p.m.: Boise Pride Festival – Cecil D. Andrus Park, Boise.
  • Saturday, June 15, 12 – 4 p.m.: – Alt-Pride Boise – Julia Davis Park, Boise.
  • Saturday, June 29, 11 a.m. – 6 p.m.: – Idaho Falls Pride-This is Me! – Idaho Falls River Parkway (Along the Greenbelt, just north of the farmer’s market), various locations, Idaho Falls.
  • Saturday, July 13, 4 – 9 p.m.: – Celebrate Love 2019 – Pioneer Park, Lewiston.
  • Saturday, August 24, 11:30 a.m. – 4 p.m.: – Palouse Pride 2019 – East City Park, Moscow.

This year we have also teamed up with Add the Words Idaho and the Intermountain Fair Housing Council to hold two “community open house” events in Twin Falls (6/7) and Pocatello (6/28). We are still finalizing the details of these events and will post them on the ACLU of Idaho website and share via Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Follow us today!

Please reach out to the ACLU of Idaho Community Engagement Manager with questions regarding 2019 Idaho Pride events.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of Idaho
